snippet: Construction paper used to be provided at school. Nowadays, it is one of many items parents are expected to provide. And yet a retailers group expects parents will spend 6 percent less this season.
abstract: Schools across United States are increasingly relying on students to provide basic classroom materials due to slashed school district budgets; action has placed large burden on many families already struggling; as result retailers expect flat back-to-school season as parents curb spending.
lead_paragraph: Construction paper used to be provided at school. Nowadays, it is one of many items parents are expected to provide. And yet a retailers group expects parents will spend 6 percent less this season.

headline.main: Parents Spending Less on Back-to-School Season Despite Growing Lists of Supplies
headline.print_headline: Trudging Back to School, Students Help Stock Schools’ Bare Supply Shelves
